recipeMethods.stepInstructions:
1. Turn on the Nieco broiler and ensure the settings are correct. Each Nieco settings may vary. Please see the executive chef for the proper setting for the Nieco in your restaurant.

2. Pre heat an electric food warmer or baine marie to 165°F.

3. Season Patties with salt and pepper.

4. Place patty on Nieco broiler chain and cook until patty reaches 165°F internal temperature.

5. Place finished patty in a #200 perforated half pan (with a drip pan to catch juices) in an electric food warmer or baine marie (with a lid. The lid should be off set to prevent burgers from steaming.)

6. Lay 1 American cheese slice on each patty in hot holding within 30-45 seconds from being done and close lid of warmer.

7. Hold Patties for 30-45 seconds (so heat from patty and holding will melt cheese).

1. Assemble the burger in the following order starting with the bottom 
of the bun:

 - bottom of bun
 - burger patty 
 - leaf lettuce
 - 1 tomato slice (center, no end cuts)
 - 3 pickle slices
 - 3 red onion rings
 - top of bun

2. The top of the bun will have a pinwheel of mayonnaise, using a squeeze bottle, which covers the bun top.


NOTE: The Bruin Burger should be served closed.
